page.title: 09THE LOSS OF COMMUNITY LIFE
page.content: "Another great change is the loss of community life. There used to be clubs and societies (whist, bridge, floral arts, etc.), in the village hall two or three evenings a week. Everyone joined in. Not any more. Many of the houses are occupied by incomers who work in the oil industry and who keep themselves very much to themselves. Until several years ago a man used to go round the area in a van selling groceries. The man went into{Aberdeen} to collect his groceries first thing in the morning before calling at all the houses for trade. The conversion of the local shop into a mini- supermarket put paid to the travelling grocer. I would miss the supermarket now as I get all my shopping there and collect my pension from the{sub-Post {Office}inside the shop."
